DOC.brief_summary: A prospective, multicenter, observational assessment of the safety and effectiveness of the LVIS® device in the treatment of wide necked intracranial aneurysms.
DOC.brief_title: TRAIL: Treatment of Intracranial Aneurysms With LVIS® System
DOC.criteria: 1. Patient or patient's legally authorized representative has been informed about the confidentiality of the study and has agreed to the collection of his/her personal data 2. Patient has a ruptured or unruptured intracranial aneurysm for which: The parent artery has a diameter ≥ 2.0mm and ≤ 4.5 mm; The aneurysm neck size is ≥ 4mm or its dometoneck ratio is < 2 (wide neck) Endovascular treatment with coils and one or more LVIS® devices has been determined necessary for the patient by the multidisciplinary team 3. Patient is aged ≥ 18 years 4. Patient presents with a WFNS score between 0 and 3 5. Patient has agreed to attend followup appointments 1. The use of an endovascular stent other than LVIS® has been determined necessary 2. Patient presents with medical or surgical comorbidities limiting his/her life expectancy to less than one year 3. Patient has a contraindication to platelet inhibition treatment 4. Patient requires retreatment of an aneurysm previously treated with a stent 5. Patient is pregnant 6. Patient has multiple aneurysms to be treated in one procedure
